clues.text: Elizabeth Montgomery had viewers in a spell as the magical Samantha Stephens on this classic sitcom
Before going "Full Frontal", Samantha Bee was a correspondent for this Comedy Central series
Samantha, the operating system in this 2013 film, shares a name with Samantha Morton, who was its original voice
After her years as Kelly Bundy, she played the amnesiac title character of "Samantha Who?"
She played the lusty Samantha Jones on "Sex & the City"
Beagles were originally bred to hunt these long-eared creatures
This scientist's life aboard the HMS Beagle included a visit to the "frying hot" Galapagos Islands
There's no need to fear, this cartoon beagle defended Capitol City
Beloved beagle Snoopy can be seen on this insurance company's blimps
One of the standard color combos for beagles is this pair, also a drink made with equal parts ale & stout
Photodegradation is chemical change affecting the usefulness of a material due to absorption of this
This type of bond is formed by 2 atoms each contributing 1 electron to a shared electron pair
Used as refrigerants, chlorofluoro-carbons are also called these, a trademark
Women process alcohol more slowly than men because their stomachs have less ADH, one of these catalysts
Change the first letter in a synonym for "trying" & you get this process of determining the proportions of metal in ore
The name of this flavoring has also come to mean plain or ordinary
"Animal Farm" is an example of this literary device in which abstract ideas appear as characters in a story
A metal capable of being shaped by hammering or pressure is said to be this
In fashion, types of these include Mandarin, Chelsea & ruff
John Dryden wrote, "What passion cannot music raise and" do this, meaning to pacify or quiet
These convertible robots in disguise who would go on to blockbuster movie fame started as an animated TV series
This mystery series about a writer who was also an amateur detective began in 1984 & ran for 12 seasons
A sitcom about cartoonists, "The Duck Factory" starred this "Truman Show" man in one of his first major roles
In that year a renegade pilot flew dangerous missions in "Airwolf", an advanced high-tech one of these
This Robin Leach show gave regular folks a glimpse of the experiences of the wealthy & the celebrated
This future actor-director has been friends with Matt Damon since they were both kids in Cambridge, Mass.
This recent movie Hulk is also green in his personal life, making efforts to combat fracking in New York State
In 2016 Nia Vardalos returned as Toula Portokalos in a sequel to this 2002 hit
"a-LISS-ee-ah" is the pronunciation of the name of this Swedish actress who won an Oscar for "The Danish Girl"
In this 2014 film Elle Fanning plays Aurora, put into a deep sleep by the title character who it turns out had her reasons
The only previous GOP nominee at the party's 2016 convention was this 92-year-old with the Kansas delegation
He received 79 1/2 delegate votes at the 1960 Democratic Convention after having lost the 1952 & '56 elections
As of 2016 he is the only major party presidential nominee still serving in the U.S. Senate
He defeated Grover Cleveland in 1888 but lost the rematch 4 years later
In 1936 this Kansas governor won only 8 electoral votes to FDR's 523
This comedian made his big screen debut in "The Santa Clause" in which he accidentally kills Santa
Colonel Potter dresses as Santa in the "Death Takes A Holiday" episode of this sitcom
John Ritter's last film appearance was in this movie, trying to keep an inebriated Billy Bob Thornton in check
Jack Skellington's plot to kidnap Santa goes awry in this stop-motion fable from Tim Burton
This '70s TV animated film featuring Heat Miser & Snow Miser was remade in 2006 with John Goodman as the big guy

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be a word like "rhymin'" that rhymes with "Simon", but don't put a "G" in there.)

clues.text: Ascendin' a cliff face
Makin' a melodious ringin' sound by strikin' a small bell
Hinderin' with trivialities, not coins
Preparin' a pump by pourin' water into it
Playin' Scott Joplin tunes on the piano

19th century documents show pirates actually made victims do this, plunge to their death by stepping off a beam
To do this provides little sustenance for the amount of mastication, which may be why it refers to idle chatter
In 2016 this disciple of Kanye West released his "Coloring Book" mixtape
"Sister Carrie" uses this dessert phrase that now means to surpass all others in a bad or unusual way
The title of this "touch and feel" board book by Dorothy Kunhardt is a command to babies, not the name of a hare
At an 1802 White House dinner, Thomas Jefferson supplied the starch with these "in the French manner"
This French military group  that formed in 1831 had its first headquarters in Sidi Bel Abbes, Algeria
This birthing method developed by a French doctor in the 1950s involves breath control & pain reduction
Post-WWII Juliette Greco made her mark on this style of song known simply by the French word for "song"
From the French for "light of hand", it's the art involved in sleight of hand

rounds.text: In 1972 he succeeded U Thant to become the U.N's 4th secretary-general
